summary: Yukon is the smallest of Canada's three territories, located in the west. It has a population of around 46,700 people, with Whitehorse as its capital. Originally part of the Northwest Territories, Yukon became a separate territory in 1898. It is officially bilingual, recognizing English, French, and First Nations languages. Mount Logan, the highest peak in Canada, is found in Yukon's Kluane National Park. The territory experiences a subarctic climate with cold winters and short, warm summers. Major rivers include the Yukon, Pelly, and Stewart.
title: Yukon
